thread.title: Comic Art Festival-goers to spend £1m in Kendal | Border
thread.title_full: Comic Art Festival-goers to spend £1m in Kendal | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Comic Art Festival-goers to spend £1m in Kendal | Border
text:
Thousands of people are in Kendal this weekend for the Lakes International Comic Art Festival.
It's important for the town's economy as it brings visitors to the area at the end of the tourist season.
It's the only festival of it's kind in the UK, which means it has a unique selling point in a niche market and so it brings crowds from all over the world.
"After the first one I started to hear a little bit about, 'oh there's a great festival in the Lakes; it's really fabulous,' and then after the second one I was hearing that even more and so when I was invited I thought, 'brilliant, yeah, I'm definitely going'."
– Steven Appleby, Transgender Comic Artist from Northumberland One of Steven Appleby's cartoons Credit: Stephen Appleby Stephen Appleby talks at Kendal's Lakes International Comic Art Festival Credit: ITV News Border This is Kendal's third Comic Art Festival and it's becoming more popular every year.
This weekend over 7,500 people are expected to spend around £1m in the local economy, filling hotel rooms at a time of year that would otherwise be quiet.
"The economic impact is big and it's important but I think it's more about actually how people feel about the place that they live and also the image that the town now has on an international stage."
– Julie Tait, Lakes International Comic Art Festival Around 7,500 people are expected to visit Kendal for the festival Credit: ITV News Border Festival-goers are expected to spend £1million in the local economy Credit: ITV News Border Shop windows become art galleries and buildings all over town host some of the biggest names in the comic art world.
"This year we've actually brought six Canadian cartoonists - many of whom for the first time in Europe - to the Kendal festival this year, and they've actually come and brought a whole bunch of British cartoonists to Toronto as well."
– Christopher Butcher, Toronto Comic Arts Festival The festival takes over the town, with most shop windows hosting art Credit: ITV News Border Comic artists come from all over the world to showcase their work Credit: ITV News Border It's one of many festivals throughout the year designed to show off Kendal to new tourist markets and is one of the reasons Kendal's becoming known all over the world for its cultural festivals.
Art students come to learn from the masters at the festival Credit: ITV News Border It's become a meeting place for comic artists from all over the world Credit: ITV News Border Last updated Sat 17 Oct 2015 Read more 3 updates Kendal Comic Art Festival Entertainment Cumbria Kendal
